titlestmt.titleproper: Haines (Cynthia Farah) papers related to Literature and Landscape
Guide to the Cynthia Farah Haines papers related to Literature and Landscape: Writers of the Southwest M2107

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-05-19 13:48:46 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Cynthia Farah Haines papers related to Literature and Landscape: Writers of the Southwest

physdesc.extent: 20 boxes (8 msbs, 6 fbs, 3 card boxes with negatives and audiocassettes, 7 books, 1 DVD, 1 CD)

did.abstract: Research material and photographs used in the production of Cynthia Farah Haines' 1988 book Literature and Landscape: Writers of the Southwest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cynthia Farah Haines (born 1949) is a photographer, film critic, and scholar who received her BA at Stanford, and began her critical career writing for the Stanford University Daily. Her book "Literature & Landscape: Writers of the Southwest, " published in 1988, features photos and biographical text about 50 Southwestern authors. The collection contains notes, correspondence, drafts, photos, negatives, audiocassettes, and other material.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Cynthia Farah Haines papers related to Literature and Landscape: Writers of the Southwest (M2107). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use. Audiovisual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns
